text: Margit Buchhalter Feldman (June 12, 1929 â€“ April 14, 2020) was a Hungarian- American public speaker, educator, activist, and Holocaust survivor. Feldman and her family put in a concentration camp in 1944, where her parents were killed. She survived after lying about her age, in which the Nazis put her in a work camp. She was freed from Bergen-Belsen concentration camp on April 15, 1945. She was born in Budapest. Feldman died on April 14, 2020 in Somerset, New Jersey of COVID-19, aged 90. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Educators from New Jersey Category:American political activists Category:Holocaust survivors Category:Hungarian Jews Category:People from Budapest
title: Margit Feldman
